thread.title: East Meck soccer star Charles Basse goes for 6 goals Wednesday vs. Rocky River
thread.title_full: East Meck soccer star Charles Basse goes for 6 goals Wednesday vs. Rocky River

author:
Langston Wertz Jr. 
lwertz@charlotteobserver.com
title: East Meck soccer star Charles Basse goes for 6 goals Wednesday vs. Rocky River
text:
East Meck soccer star Charles Basse goes for 6 goals Wednesday vs. Rocky River 
Basse is an Observer top performer for Wednesday’s action 
Myers Park dominates at Southwestern 4A conference tennis 
South Meck soccer stays unbeaten East Meck’s Charles Basse, center, had six goals in a match Wednesday Cliff Mehrtens/Special to the Observer East Meck’s Charles Basse, his school’s all-time leading scorer, had six goals Wednesday Special to the Observer 1 of 2 Wednesday’s Top Performers 
Dallas Baker, Ardrey Kell soccer: four goals in a 9-0 win over Harding. 
Charles Basse, East Mecklenburg: school’s all-time leading scorer had six goals in a 7-5 win over Rocky River. Read a profile on Basse here . 
Sarah Novroski, Lake Norman Charter volleyball: 32 assists, 10 digs, six kills, three aces in 3-1 win over Ashbrook. 
Nick Aparicio, Providence soccer: four goals in a 4-1 win over Berry. 
Aish Sharma, Charlotte Country Day girls golf: shot a 42 to win medalist honors in a two-team match with High Point’s Wesleyan Christian Wednesday over nine holes covering 2,811 yards at Cedarwood Country Club. Country Day (3-11) won the match 141-154. Wednesday’s Roundup 
South Meck soccer 9, West Meck 0: Led by three goals and an assist from Marco Garcia, South Mecklenburg’s boys soccer team remained unbeaten with a 9-0 win over West Mecklenburg Wednesday. 
Reed Hunnicut had two goals and one assist for the Sabres (14-0-1, 9-0 Southwestern 4A). Dylan Rice and Harish Amatya shared the shutout. 
Mallard Creek soccer 5, Hough 3: Mallard Creek pulled off a big upset in MECKA 8 conference play Wednesday. The Mavericks (7-10-1, 6-1) won their third straight game and pulled into a first-place tie with Hough (12-2-2, 6-1). 
Lake Norman Charter volleyball 3, Ashbrook 1: Lauren Gedney had 13 skills and Sabrina Pinard 12 to lead Lake Norman Charter (14-5, 11-2 Big South). Lake Norman Charter finishes regular-season play Monday against North Gaston on Senior Night. 
Ardrey Kell soccer 9, Harding 0: Justin Brown got his seventh shutout of the season and Zain Blackwood had two goals as the Knights (11-5-3, 8-2 SoMeck 8) won easily. Harding fell to 0-11, 0-9. 
Central Academy soccer 1, Monroe 0: Central Academy coach Jay Niessner won his 100th match as a coach at the school. Trevor Weimer had the goal for Central off an assist from Roberto Fleming. Brandon Melchor, who had eight saves, earned the shutout for Central Academy (9-6-4, 5-1). Monroe fell to 10-6, 4-2. 
Southwestern 4A tennis: Myers Park’s Leah Wallihan and Aubrey Bader defeated teammates Katie and Gaby Soden 1-6, 6-4, 6-3 to win the conference doubles title. Myers Park’s Maddie Weber beat teammate Emily Holderness 6-0, 6-1 to win in singles. Complete results below. 
Providence Day field hockey 5, Ardrey Kell 0: Abbey Anne Briggs got the shutout for the Chargers, who got goals from Lily Norris, Celine Ives, Sara Cotsakis, Danille Kapustin and Hannah Scully. 
Lincoln Charter soccer 2, Community School of Davidson 1: Lincoln Charter handed Community School (15-1-1, 8-1) its first loss of the season. Jason Coggins had the score for CSD. Southwestern 4A tennis results 
SINGLES: 
First Round: Talia Weinstein (B) d. Ravin Webster (RR) 7-6 (5), 4-6, 6-4; Nhi Nguyen (EM) d. Katie Pelay 6-2, 6-0 
Quarterfinals: Maddie Weber (MP) d. Aleena Oakley 6-0, 6-0; Olivia Philips (PR) d. Weinstein 6-2, 6-1; Emmy Woodson (PR) d. Nguyen 4-6, 6-3, 6-1; Emily Holderness (MP) d. Ivy Mathis (B) 6-0, 6-3 
Semifinals: Weber d. Philips 6-0, 6-1; Holderness d. Woodson 6-0, 6-2 
Final: Maddie Weber (MP) d. Emily Holderness (MP) 6-0, 6-1 
DOUBLES: 
First Round: Tesfai/Lucarelli (PR) d. Stringer/Vital (B) 6-2, 6-2; Robinson/Sui (EM) d. Johnson/Jhonson (RR) 6-1, 6-0; Exum/Zappernick (I) d. Coughlin/K. Nguyen (EM) 6-2, 6-0; Sirico/Barnhardt (B) d. Vallalba/McDow (RR) 6-0, 6-0 
Quarterfinals: Soden/Soden (MP) d. Tesfai/Lucarelli 6-0, 6-1; Ducar/Stauffer (I) d. Robinson/Sui 6-0, 6-1; 
Walliahn/Bader (MP) d. Exum/ Zeppernick 6-0, 6-1; Ferris/Stedem (PR) d. Sirico/Barnhardt 6-2, 6-2 
Semifinals: Soden/Soden d. Ducar/Stauffer 6-1, 6-0; 
Wallihan/Bader d. Farris/Stedem 6-0, 6-0 
Final: Leah Wallihan/Aubrey Bader (MP) d. Katie Soden/Gaby Soden (MP) 1-6, 6-4, 6-3 
KEY: 
B: Butler, EM: East Mecklenburg, I: Independence 
PR: Porter Ridge, RR: Rocky River 
MP: Myers Park South Meck's Marco Garcia, right, gets a hug from teammate Fernando Garcia. Marco Garcia helped his team to a shutout win against West Meck Wednesday. Photo by JASON E. MICZEK - Special to the Observer JASON E. MICZEK WWW.MICZEKPHOTO.COM i
